datasheets.Weirdboy.abilities.other.0.de: While this model is leading a unit, add 1 to the Strength and Damage characteristics of this model’s ’Eadbanger weapon for every 5 models in that unit (rounding down), but while that unit contains 10 or more models, that weapon has the [HAZARDOUS] ability.
datasheets.Weirdboy.abilities.other.1.de: Once per turn, at the end of your Movement phase, one WEIRDBOY from your army can use this ability. If it does, roll one D6: on a 1, that WEIRDBOY’s unit suffers D6 mortal wounds; on a 2+, remove that WEIRDBOY’s unit from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
datasheets.Weirdboy.fluff: Weirdboyz channel the Waaagh! energy that builds up around battling Orks, unleashing it before it causes their heads to literally explode. This they do with gusto, whether vomiting blasts of devastating green ectoplasm at the enemy or teleporting Orks madly about the place.
datasheets.Weirdboy.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ BOYZ
datasheets.Weirdboy.loadout: This model is equipped with: ’Eadbanger; weirdboy staff.
Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it and roll one D6: on a 2‑5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds.
datasheets.Megatrakk_Scrapjet.fluff: Just because an Ork aircraft has lost a wing or two, doesn’t mean some enterprising Speed Freek can’t find a tremendously violent use for it. Megatrakk Scrapjets tear across the battlefield shooting hails of rokkits before  ploughing nose‑drill‑first through the enemy lines, drivers bellowing with glee the whole time.
datasheets.Megatrakk_Scrapjet.loadout: This model is equipped with: rokkit kannon; 2 twin big shootas; wing missiles; nose drill.
datasheets.Warbikers.abilities.other.0.d: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
datasheets.Warbikers.fluff: Ork Warbikers race into battle with dakkaguns hammering, ragged trails of dust and smoke boiling up behind them like an ill omen. They race one another at breakneck pace to reach the enemy first, execute death‑defying stunts at suicidal speeds, then crash headlong into the foe’s battle line like battering rams.
datasheets.Warbikers.loadout: Every model is equipped with: twin dakkagun; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Warbikers.stats.0.name: Warbiker
datasheets.Warbikers.stats.1.name: Boss Nob on Warbike
datasheets.Warbikers.wargear.0: The Boss Nob on Warbike can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 slugga ◦ 1 big choppa ◦ 1 power klaw
datasheets.Warbikers.wargear.1: Each Warbiker can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 slugga ◦ 1 choppa
Each time this unit ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit it moved over during that move and roll one D6 for each model in this unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
datasheets.Deffkoptas.fluff: Most Orks take a dim view of muckin’ about in the sky, and would much rather go to war with their feet firmly on the ground. Deffkopta pilots are a lunatic exception, hurtling ahead to spy out enemy forces for their warband to bring to battle, and to give those same enemies a good strafing run or three in the meantime.
datasheets.Deffkoptas.loadout: Every model is equipped with: kopta rokkits; slugga; spinnin’ blades.
datasheets.Deffkoptas.wargear.0: For every 3 models in this unit, 1 Deffkopta can have its kopta rokkits replaced with 1 kustom mega-blasta.
datasheets.Kustom_Boosta_blasta.abilitie: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks made with a rivet kannon. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is suppressed. While a unit is suppressed, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
datasheets.Kustom_Boosta_blasta.fluff: Meks who build Kustom Boosta‑blastas have the alarming habit of wiring themselves into the vehicles’ rivet kannons as though into very fast and shooty Deff Dreads. They then speed to war, aiming hails of arm‑length metal rivets at the enemy while scorching them with the Boosta‑blasta’s flame‑jetting exhausts.
datasheets.Kustom_Boosta_blasta.loadout: This model is equipped with: burna exhausts; grot blasta; rivet kannon; spiked ram.
datasheets.Kustom_Boosta_blasta.name: Kustom Boosta-blasta
datasheets.Painboy.abilities.other.0.des: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.
datasheets.Painboy.abilities.other.1.des: Each time an attack made by this model with its ’urty syringe scores a Critical Wound against a unit (excluding VEHICLE units), that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
datasheets.Painboy.abilities.wargear.0.d: Once per battle, in your Command phase, if the bearer is leading a unit that is below its Starting Strength, you can return up to D3 destroyed Bodyguard models to that unit.
datasheets.Painboy.fluff: The traditional tools of the Painboy help them to patch up even the most mangled Orks and send them back into the fight. Helpfully, all these gruesome surgical klaws, rippy saws and fat syringes also serve as an expedient means of dismembering the enemy with – if not surgical precision – at least a great deal of enthusiasm!
datasheets.Painboy.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BOYZ ■ NOBZ ■ LOOTAS ■ BURNA BOYZ ■ TANKBUSTAS
datasheets.Painboy.loadout: This model is equipped with: power klaw; ’urty syringe.
datasheets.Painboy.wargear.0: This model can be equipped with 1 grot orderly.
Each time this unit is selected to shoot, you can roll one D6:

■ On a 1‑2, this unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
■ On a 3‑4, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in this unit.
■ On a 5‑6, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in this unit.
datasheets.Killa_Kans.fluff: Surgically wiring grots into combat walkers is risky: the runty loons tend to go on a bit of a power trip, hazardous to every Ork that ever treated them badly. On the other hand, their ability to shoot straight renders their hails of rokkits, bullets and grotzooka‑launched scrap‑shrapnel even more hazardous to the foe.
datasheets.Killa_Kans.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Kan shoota; Kan klaw.
datasheets.Killa_Kans.wargear.0: Each Killa Kan’s Kan shoota can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 grotzooka ◦ 1 rokkit launcha ◦ 1 skorcha
datasheets.Lootas.abilities.other.0.name: Dat’s Our Loot!
datasheets.Lootas.abilities.other.0.desc: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If that attack targets a unit that is within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.
datasheets.Lootas.fluff: Lootas grub together every toof and fistful of scrap they can, then use the former to pay the Meks to turn the latter into very, very large guns. These they then turn on the enemy with gleeful abandon, unleashing such prodigious – if erratic – hails of fire that they can stop a battle tank in its tracks or scythe down squads of infantry.
datasheets.Lootas.loadout:
Every Spanner is equipped with: big shoota; close combat weapon.
Every Loota is equipped with: deffgun; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Lootas.stats.0.name: Loota
datasheets.Lootas.wargear.0: Any number of Spanners can each have their big shoota replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 kustom mega-blasta ◦ 1 rokkit launcha
datasheets.Big_Mek.abilities.other.0.des: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.
datasheets.Big_Mek.abilities.other.1.des: You can re‑roll Advance rolls made for this model’s unit. In addition, each time this model’s unit makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, until that move is finished, models in that unit can move horizontally through models and terrain features (but cannot finish a move on top of another model or its base).
datasheets.Big_Mek.fluff: Big Meks build all sorts of powerful weapons and bizarre devices. They readily bring their favourites into battle to test ’em out, even building and wearing a bionik exoskeleton to help them wield as many as possible. So equipped, the Big Mek unleashes mechanical violence and blasts of energy, or wrenches open warp tunnels down which he and his followers pile into the fight.
datasheets.Big_Mek.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BOYZ ■ LOOTAS ■ MEK GUNZ ■ NOBZ
datasheets.Big_Mek.loadout: This model is equipped with: kustom mega‑blasta; power klaw.
datasheets.Big_Mek.wargear.0: This model’s power klaw can be replaced with 1 drilla.
datasheets.Big_Mek.wargear.1: This model’s kustom mega‑blasta can be replaced with 1 traktor blasta.
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.abilities.other: You can ignore any or all modifiers to this unit’s Move characteristic and to Advance and Charge rolls made for this unit.
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.abilities.warge: Once per battle for each bomb squig this unit has, after this unit ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit within 12" of it and roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.composition.0: 1 Nob on Smasha Squig and 3 Squighog Boyz
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.composition.2: 2 Nobz on Smasha Squigs and 6 Squighog Boyz
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.fluff: With their mounts snorting and saddlegitz hanging on for dear life, Squighog Boyz thunder into the fight, flinging rokkit‑propelled stikkas with enough force to pierce plate armour. Led into the fray by Nobz atop thick‑skulled smasha squigs, they employ muscle, weight, momentum and sheer belligerence to squash those foes still standing to a paste.
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.loadout:
Every Nob on Smasha Squig is equipped with: slugga; big choppa; squig jaws.
Every Squighog Boy is equipped with: saddlegit weapons; stikka; squig jaws.
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.stats.0.name: Squighog Boy
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.stats.1.name: Nob on Smasha Squig
datasheets.Squighog_Boyz.wargear.0: For every 4 models in this unit, this unit can be equipped with 1 bomb squig.
datasheets.Warboss_in_Mega_Armour.abilit: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.
While the Waaagh! is active for your army, this model’s ’uge choppa has a Damage characteristic of 3.
datasheets.Warboss_in_Mega_Armour.fluff: Any good Ork hunter knows the safest way to deal with a rampaging Warboss is to hit them with tank‑busting artillery from as far away as possible. By donning a piston‑driven suit of incredibly durable mega armour, the Warboss makes a mockery of such underhanded enemy tactics, much to the terror of his foes.
datasheets.Warboss_in_Mega_Armour.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ MEGANOBZ
datasheets.Warboss_in_Mega_Armour.loadou: This model is equipped with: big shoota; ’uge choppa.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.abilities.da: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.abilities.ot: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a unit that cannot FLY, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.abilities.wa: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save, but it loses the GRENADES keyword.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.fluff: Some Meks take to the skies in their own kustom aircraft. The result is the Wazbom Blastajet, an airborne workshop that is wreathed in a protective force field, and bristling with weird weapons that pluck their targets from the ground, blast them to atoms or rip them apart with conflicting tellyporta beams.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.loadout: This model is equipped with: smasha gun; twin wazbom mega-kannon; armoured hull.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.wargear.0: This model can be equipped with 1 twin supa-shoota.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.wargear.1: This model can be equipped with 1 blastajet force field.
datasheets.Wazbom_Blastajet.wargear.2: This model’s twin wazbom mega-kannon can be replaced with 1 twin tellyport mega-blasta.
datasheets.Battlewagon.abilities.damaged: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
datasheets.Battlewagon.abilities.other.0: Each time an attack is allocated to this model, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
datasheets.Battlewagon.abilities.wargear: Add 2 to the bearer’s Toughness characteristic, but it no longer has the Firing Deck ability.
datasheets.Battlewagon.fluff: No two Battlewagons are the same, for the Meks that build them can never resist cobbling on armour plates, ramming spikes, assorted dakka and random worky‑gubbinz. However, all are rugged transport tanks with the capacity to bear a large number of angry Orks into battle while shrugging off the worst the enemy can throw at them.
datasheets.Battlewagon.loadout: This model is equipped with: tracks and wheels.
datasheets.Battlewagon.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 22 ORKS INFANTRY models. If this model is equipped with a killkannon, it has a transport capacity of 12 ORKS INFANTRY models. Each MEGA ARMOUR or JUMP PACK model takes up the space of 2 models. The GHAZGHKULL THRAKA model takes up the space of 15 models but can only embark within this model if this model is not equipped with an ’ard case, kannon, killkannon or zzap gun.
datasheets.Battlewagon.wargear.0: This model can be equipped with any of the following:  ◦ 1 ’ard case ◦ 1 grabbin’ klaw ◦ 1 wreckin’ ball
datasheets.Battlewagon.wargear.1: This model’s tracks and wheels can be replaced with 1 deff rolla.
datasheets.Battlewagon.wargear.2: This model can be equipped with up to 4 big shootas.
datasheets.Battlewagon.wargear.3: This model can be equipped with:  ◦ 1 lobba
datasheets.Battlewagon.wargear.4: This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 kannon ◦ 1 killkannon ◦ 1 zzap gun
While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Benefit of Cover.

Once per battle, in your Movement phase, instead of making a Normal move with this model’s unit, you can remove it from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
datasheets.Boss_Snikrot.fluff: Boss Snikrot is a murderous ghost whose obsession with kommando warfare has seen him transcend the cunning of his fellow Blood Axes and achieve instead something nigh supernatural. By the time his terrified foes realise he is upon them, the Boss is already opening their throats with his rip‑toothed blades.
datasheets.Boss_Snikrot.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ KOMMANDOS
datasheets.Boss_Snikrot.loadout: This model is equipped with: slugga; Mork’s Teeth.
datasheets.Morkanaut.abilities.damaged.d: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, subtract 4 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic, and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
datasheets.Morkanaut.abilities.other.0.d: Each time this model makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move over enemy models (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) and terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.
datasheets.Morkanaut.abilities.other.1.d: Each time this model makes a ranged attack, if the Waaagh! is active for your army, add 1 to the Hit roll.
datasheets.Morkanaut.fluff: Usually piloted by the exiled Badmek who built it, a Morkanaut is a hulking combat walker with a dash of Mork‑esque know‑wotz applied. Packed with glowy gubbinz and wreathed in a kustom force field, Morkanauts unleash their arsenals of bizarre and deadly weapons in what their pilots think of as displays of pure kunnin’ worthy of Mork.
datasheets.Morkanaut.loadout: This model is equipped with: kustom mega-blasta; kustom mega-zappa; 2 rokkit launchas; 2 twin big shootas; klaw of Mork.
datasheets.Morkanaut.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 ORKS INFANTRY models (excluding GHAZGHKULL THRAKA). Each MEGA ARMOUR or JUMP PACK model takes up the space of 2 models.
datasheets.Ghazghkull_Thraka.abilities.o: While this unit is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll and if the Waaagh! is active for your army, a Critical Hit is scored on a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+.
While a friendly ORKS unit is within 12" of Makari, if the Waaagh! is active for your army, melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
datasheets.Ghazghkull_Thraka.abilities.s: If this unit is in your army, its Ghazghkull Thraka model must be your WARLORD.
datasheets.Ghazghkull_Thraka.fluff: To face Ghazghkull Thraka in battle is to die. Messily. He is a totemic war leader of great kunnin’ and terrifying presence who enjoys the personal protection of the Ork gods, not that he seems to need it! Makari, Ghazghkull’s favoured Grot assistant, bears aloft the personal Waaagh! banner of the Grand Warlord. There isn’t an Ork living who doesn’t fight harder in sight of that bosspole.
datasheets.Ghazghkull_Thraka.leader: This unit can be attached to the following unit: ■ MEGANOBZ If this unit’s Bodyguard unit is destroyed, Ghazkghull Thraka and Makari become a single unit with their original Starting Strength.
datasheets.Ghazghkull_Thraka.loadout:
Ghazghkull Thraka is equipped with: Mork’s Roar; Gork’s Klaw.
Makari is equipped with: Makari’s stabba.
datasheets.Ghazghkull_Thraka.name: Ghazghkull Thraka
datasheets.Ghazghkull_Thraka.leads.extra: If this unit’s Bodyguard unit is destroyed, Ghazkghull Thraka and Makari become a single unit with their original Starting Strength.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.abilities.other.0: Each time this unit declares a charge, you can re-roll the Charge roll.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.abilities.other.1:
Twice per battle, after this unit ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit within 12" of it and roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

Designer’s Note: Place two Bomb Squig tokens next to the unit, removing one each time this unit uses this ability.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.abilities.special: If a CHARACTER unit from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a BOYZ unit, it can be attached to this unit instead.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.fluff: Breaka Boyz dismantle the foe’s war engines and defences with well-placed krumpings from their smash hammers. Some use a pair of brutal knucklebustas, while the more addled opt for a tankhammer: a rokkit strapped to a big metal stick that offers a satisfyingly explosive means of up-close annihilation.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.loadout:
The Boss Nob is equipped with: rokkit pistol; smash hammer; choppa.
Each Breaka Boy is equipped with: smash hammer.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.stats.0.name: Breaka Boy
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.wargear.0: One Breaka Boy’s smash hammer can be replaced with 1 tankhammer.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.wargear.1: One Breaka Boy’s smash hammer can be replaced with 1 knucklebustas.
datasheets.Breaka_Boyz.wargear.2: The Boss Nob’s smash hammer can be replaced with 1 rokkit pistol.
datasheets.Stompa.abilities.damaged.desc: While this model has 1-10 wounds remaining, subtract 6 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
datasheets.Stompa.abilities.other.0.name: Waaagh! Effigy (Aura)
datasheets.Stompa.abilities.other.0.desc: While a friendly ORKS unit is within 12" of this model, each time you take a Battle‑shock test for that unit, add 1 to that test.
datasheets.Stompa.abilities.other.1.name: Stompin’ Forward
datasheets.Stompa.abilities.other.1.desc: Each time this model makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move over models (excluding TITANIC models) and terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.
datasheets.Stompa.fluff: Something akin to a bad‑tempered, armour‑plated mountain covered in guns, the Stompa is a walking idol to Gork and Mork. It packs enough firepower to level an enemy fortress or annihilate entire formations of troops with a single volley, while anything unlucky enough to get within reach is soon crushed flat.
datasheets.Stompa.loadout: This model is equipped with: 3 big shootas; deffkannon; skorcha; supa-gatler; supa-rokkits; twin big shoota; mega-choppa.
datasheets.Stompa.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 22 ORKS INFANTRY models. Each MEGA ARMOUR or JUMP PACK model takes up the space of 2 models. The GHAZGHKULL THRAKA model takes up the space of 15 models.
datasheets.Biged_Bossbunka.abilities.oth: Each time a ranged attack is allocated to a model, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of this FORTIFICATION, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.
While a friendly ORKS unit is within 6" of this FORTIFICATION, improve the Leadership characteristic of models in that unit by 1.

While an enemy unit is only within Engagement Range of one or more FORTIFICATIONS from your army:

■ That unit can still be selected as the target of ranged attacks, but each time such an attack is made, unless it is made with a Pistol, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
■ Models in that unit do not need to take Desperate Escape tests due to Falling Back while Battle-shocked, except for those that will move over enemy models when doing so.
datasheets.Biged_Bossbunka.fluff: Having a Gargant’s severed head serve as a boss’ hut is not only a status symbol, but also provides a base of operations equipped with a remarkable array of Orky features – from the potent Gaze of Gork built into one eye to the kommanda’s shoutin’ pole that carries the boss’ bellowed commands far and wide.
datasheets.Biged_Bossbunka.loadout: This model is equipped with: big shoota; Gaze of Gork.
datasheets.Biged_Bossbunka.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 11 ORKS INFANTRY models. Each MEGA ARMOUR or JUMP PACK model takes up the space of 2 models.
datasheets.Biged_Bossbunka.wargear.0: This model can be equipped with up to 3 additional big shootas.
Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.
Twice per battle, after this unit ends a Normal move, you can use one Bomb Squig. If you do, select one enemy unit within 12" and visible to this unit and roll one D6: on a 3+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

Designer’s Note: Place two Bomb Squig tokens next to the unit, removing one each time this unit uses this ability.
If a CHARACTER unit from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a LOOTAS unit, it can be attached to this unit instead.
Once per battle, when the bearer’s unit is selected to shoot in your Shooting phase, the bearer can use its pulsa rokkit. If it does, until the end of the phase, improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of ranged weapons equipped by models in the bearer’s unit by 1.
datasheets.Tankbustas.fluff: Tankbustas fixate on blasting enemy vehicles into scrap using barrages of rokkits that detonate in deafening explosions. They wield varied, cobbled-together launchas, and are laden with an arsenal of explosive projectiles, whose dubious reliability is made up for by the Tankbustas’ enthusiasm.
datasheets.Tankbustas.loadout:
The Boss Nob is equipped with: 2 rokkit pistols; choppa.
Each Tankbusta is equipped with: rokkit launcha; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Tankbustas.stats.0.name: Boss Nob
datasheets.Tankbustas.stats.1.name: Tankbusta
datasheets.Tankbustas.wargear.0: One Tankbusta can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 pulsa rokkit ◦ 1 additional rokkit launcha
datasheets.Tankbustas.wargear.1: 1 of the Boss Nob’s rokkit pistols can be replaced with 1 smash hammer.
datasheets.Kommandos.abilities.other.0.d: Enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at this unit.
datasheets.Kommandos.abilities.wargear.0: Once per battle, after this unit ends a Normal move, select one enemy unit within 12" of this unit and roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
datasheets.Kommandos.abilities.wargear.1: Once per battle, in your opponent’s Shooting phase, before making a saving throw for a model in this unit, it can deploy the distraction grot. If it does, until the end of the phase, models in this unit have a 5+ invulnerable save.
datasheets.Kommandos.fluff: No right‑thinking Ork trusts Kommandos. They sneak up on the enemy rather than charging in headlong, and have an unhealthy fascination with very big knives and their application to people’s backs, throats and guts. That said, having a band of Kommandos ambush the enemy mid‑battle definitely has its uses.
datasheets.Kommandos.loadout: Every model is equipped with: slugga; choppa.
datasheets.Kommandos.stats.0.name: Kommando
datasheets.Kommandos.wargear.0: This unit can be equipped with 1 distraction grot.
datasheets.Kommandos.wargear.1: This unit can be equipped with 1 bomb squig.
datasheets.Kommandos.wargear.2: 1 Kommando’s slugga and choppa can be replaced with 1 rokkit launcha and 1 close combat weapon.
datasheets.Kommandos.wargear.3: 1 Kommando’s slugga and choppa can be replaced with 1 burna and 1 close combat weapon.
datasheets.Kommandos.wargear.4: 1 Kommando’s slugga and choppa can be replaced with 1 breacha ram.
datasheets.Kommandos.wargear.5: Up to 2 Kommandos can each have their slugga and choppa replaced with 1 Kustom shoota and 1 close combat weapon.
datasheets.Kommandos.wargear.6: The Boss Nob’s choppa can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 big choppa ◦ 1 power klaw
datasheets.Boyz.abilities.other.0.name: Get Da Good Bitz
datasheets.Boyz.abilities.other.0.descri: At the end of your Command phase, if this unit is within range of an objective marker you control, that objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.
datasheets.Boyz.abilities.special.0.desc: If this unit has a Starting Strength of 20, you can attach up to two Leader units to it instead of one (but only if one of those is a WARBOSS model). If you do, and this unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.Boyz.abilities.special.0.name: Bodyguard
datasheets.Boyz.fluff: Ork Boyz surge into battle in huge, unruly mobs dotted with crude but powerful weapons and led by foul‑tempered Boss Nobz. Most simply stampede towards the enemy lines, relying on their numbers and natural hardiness to carry the charge home, while others hitch a ride on Trukks and Battlewagons so as to get stuck in all the faster.
datasheets.Boyz.loadout:
The Boss Nob is equipped with: slugga; big choppa.
Every Boy is equipped with: slugga; choppa.
datasheets.Boyz.stats.0.name: Boy
datasheets.Boyz.wargear.0: For every 10 models in this unit, 1 Boy’s choppa and slugga can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 big shoota and 1 close combat weapon ◦ 1 rokkit launcha and 1 close combat weapon
datasheets.Boyz.wargear.1: Any number of Boyz can each have their slugga and choppa replaced with 1 shoota and 1 close combat weapon.
datasheets.Boyz.wargear.2: The Boss Nob’s big choppa and slugga can be replaced with 1 kombi-weapon and 1 close combat weapon.
datasheets.Boyz.wargear.3: The Boss Nob’s big choppa can be replaced with 1 power klaw.
datasheets.Boyz.leadBy.4: Big Mek with Shokk Attack Gun
datasheets.Trukk.abilities.other.0.name: Grot Riggers
datasheets.Trukk.abilities.other.0.descr: At the start of your Command phase, this model regains 1 lost wound.
datasheets.Trukk.fluff: Trukks are ramshackle assemblages of hastily welded and riveted scrap metal bolted to overpowered engine blocks and rusty chassis. Rolling on fat, armoured tyres, they bear mobs of Orks into battle at high speed, shrugging off enemy fire by the simple expedient of shedding ablative panels and plates.
datasheets.Trukk.loadout: This model is equipped with: big shoota; spiked wheels.
datasheets.Trukk.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 ORKS INFANTRY models. Each MEGA ARMOUR model takes up the space of 2 models. It cannot transport JUMP PACK or GHAZGHKULL THRAKA models.
datasheets.Trukk.wargear.0: This model can be equipped with 1 wreckin’ ball.
datasheets.Painboss.abilities.other.1.de: At the end of your Movement phase, select one friendly BEAST SNAGGA CHARACTER model within 3" of this model. That model is healed and regains up to 3 lost wounds. Each model can only be healed once per turn.
datasheets.Painboss.fluff: The Painboss specialises in both the surgical care and cyber‑augmentation of squigs, and of those suffering squig‑related injuries. So as to provide their services on the hoof, Painbosses augment themselves with piston‑driven supa‑legz, monowheels and the like – the better to deliver high‑speed doktorin’.
datasheets.Painboss.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ BEAST SNAGGA BOYZ
datasheets.Painboss.loadout: This model is equipped with: Beast Snagga klaw.
datasheets.Gorkanaut.abilities.damaged.d: While this model has 1‑7 wounds remaining, subtract 4 from this model’s Objective Control characteristic, and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
datasheets.Gorkanaut.abilities.other.1.d: Each time this model makes a melee attack, if the Waaagh! is active for your army, add 1 to the Hit roll.
datasheets.Gorkanaut.fluff: Outcast Nobz pilot these lumbering war engines, following the echoing call of the Waaagh! out across the stars. They are welcomed by Ork warbands wherever they go, for the punishing hails of firepower they can unleash are devastating, and few foes can long survive the grasp of their enormous, piston‑powered klaws.
datasheets.Gorkanaut.loadout: This model is equipped with: deffstorm mega-shoota; 2 rokkit launchas; skorcha; 2 twin big shootas; klaw of Gork.
datasheets.Gorkanaut.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 ORKS INFANTRY models. Each MEGA ARMOUR or JUMP PACK model takes up the space of 2 models. It cannot transport GHAZGHKULL THRAKA.
datasheets.Mek_Gunz.abilities.other.0.de: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets a unit that is at its Starting Strength (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES), re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.
datasheets.Mek_Gunz.fluff: From guns that spew unstable force‑bubbles to overcharged energy cannons, gravity beamers that crumple their targets like a squig‑oil canister in a Nob’s fist to tractor‑beams that toss foes about and drag planes from the air, the only unifying factor about the madcap Mek Gunz is what a mess they make of the foe.
datasheets.Mek_Gunz.loadout: Every model is equipped with: smasha gun; grot crew.
datasheets.Mek_Gunz.wargear.0: Each model’s smasha gun can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 bubblechukka ◦ 1 kustom mega-kannon ◦ 1 traktor kannon
datasheets.Stormboyz.abilities.other.0.d: This unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.
datasheets.Stormboyz.fluff: Most Orks mock Stormboyz for their acts of juvenile rebellion, from taking orders and shining their boots to marching about, talking about ‘taktiks’ and even following a battle plan. Yet when that plan is strap on a high powered rokkit and hurtle into the enemy bellowing “Waaagh!’, it does prove to have its merits.
datasheets.Stormboyz.stats.0.name: Stormboy
datasheets.Stormboyz.wargear.0: The Boss Nob’s choppa can be replaced with 1 power klaw.
Each time a model in this unit targets the closest eligible target with its snazzgun, until the end of the phase, that weapon has an Attacks characteristic of 4.
Once per battle, when this unit is selected to shoot, it can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
datasheets.Flash_Gitz.fluff: Flash Gitz are despised by other Orks for being self‑important show‑offs with too much snazz and dakka for their own good. The Gitz couldn’t care less, of course, delighting in ostentatiously brandishing their over‑the‑top snazzguns before using them to utterly demolish the enemy in a hail of shells, blasts and rokkits.
datasheets.Flash_Gitz.loadout: Every model is equipped with: snazzgun; choppa.
datasheets.Flash_Gitz.stats.0.name: Flash Git
datasheets.Flash_Gitz.wargear.0: This unit can be equipped with 1 ammo runt.
datasheets.Blitza_bommer.abilities.other: Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit it moved over during that move and roll one D6: on a 4+, that unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.
datasheets.Blitza_bommer.fluff: While not as shooty as a Dakkajet, each Blitza‑bommer lugs enormous boom bombs into battle under its wings. Dive‑bombing the enemy with reckless abandon, the Blitza‑bommer pilots detach their oversized payloads before – hopefully – pulling up and screaming skywards again while vast fireballs billow in their wake.
datasheets.Blitza_bommer.loadout: This model is equipped with: big shoota; twin supa-shoota; armoured hull.
At the start of the Fight phase, each enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more units with this ability must take a Battle-shock test.
datasheets.Deff_Dread.fluff: Being wired into a Deff Dread affords strength, resilience and a terrifying array of vicious weaponry. Of course, the reality of being stuck in a metal box for life and drinking your meals through a straw soon gets old, but the pilots’ resulting unhinged ferocity only serves to make Deff Dreads all the more dangerous in battle.
datasheets.Deff_Dread.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 big shootas; 2 Dread klaws; stompy feet.
datasheets.Deff_Dread.meleeWeapons.1.abi: The Attacks characteristic of this weapon is increased by 1 for each additional dread klaw this model is equipped with.
datasheets.Deff_Dread.wargear.0: This model’s dread klaws can each be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 big shoota ◦ 1 kustom-mega blasta ◦ 1 rokkit launcha ◦ 1 skorcha
datasheets.Deff_Dread.wargear.1: This model’s big shootas can each be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 dread klaw ◦ 1 kustom-mega blasta ◦ 1 rokkit launcha ◦ 1 skorcha
datasheets.Wurrboy.abilities.other.0.des: While this model is leading a unit, add 2 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s Eyez of Mork weapon for every 5 models in that unit (rounding down), but while that unit contains 10 or more models, that weapon has the [HAZARDOUS] ability.
datasheets.Wurrboy.abilities.other.1.des: In your opponent’s Command phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this PSYKER and roll one D6: on a 1, this PSYKER’s unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2+, until the start of your opponent’s next Command phase, that enemy unit is confrazzled. While a unit is confrazzled, each time a Battle‑shock or Leadership test is taken for it, subtract 2 from that test.
datasheets.Wurrboy.fluff: Rarely lucid, Wurrboyz rant about visions of prey and lose themselves in the senses of their warband’s squigs. This doesn’t stop them unleashing their devastating powers, however, channelling the Waaagh! into overwhelming primal manifestations and beams of killing energy shot from their Eyez of Mork.
datasheets.Wurrboy.loadout: This model is equipped with: Eyez of Mork; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Beastboss.abilities.other.1.d: Each time this model makes a Charge move, until the end of the turn, melee weapons it is equipped with have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
datasheets.Beastboss.fluff: It takes a ferocious and foul‑tempered Ork to lead a stampede of Beast Snaggas. Beastbosses possess these qualities in abundance. Boasting cybork enhancements, wired‑in targetin’ squigs and an array of brutal combat weaponry, these roaring monsters can bring down even the largest prey one‑on‑one.
datasheets.Beastboss.loadout: This model is equipped with: shoota; beastchoppa; Beast Snagga klaw.
datasheets.Dakkajet.abilities.other.0.de: Each time this model makes a ranged attack, every successful Hit roll scores a Critical Hit.
datasheets.Dakkajet.fluff: Rocketing through the skies on billowing trails of flame and smoke, Dakkajets come in low and hard over the battlefield. These single‑seater Ork attack craft are ludicrously over‑gunned for their size, all but shaking themselves apart as their pilots unleash storms of dakka on luckless ground targets or enemy aircraft with equal glee.
datasheets.Dakkajet.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 twin supa-shootas; armoured hull.
datasheets.Dakkajet.wargear.0: This model can be equipped with 1 additional twin supa-shoota.
datasheets.Big_Mek_in_Mega_Armour.abilit: While this model is leading a unit, in your Command phase, you can return 1 destroyed Bodyguard model to that unit.
While the bearer is leading a unit, models in that unit have a 4+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.
Once per battle, at the end of your Movement phase, one model in the bearer’s unit regains D3 lost wounds.
datasheets.Big_Mek_in_Mega_Armour.fluff: For all that its weight is akin to wearing half a tank, mega armour is incredibly resilient. Big Meks often build and wear it, adding unstable kustom weaponry, force field projectors, crushing klaws or even tellyport blastas that kill victims by beaming their component parts across a wide area, much to the Orks’ amusement.
datasheets.Big_Mek_in_Mega_Armour.loadou: This model is equipped with: kustom‑mega blasta; power klaw.
datasheets.Big_Mek_in_Mega_Armour.wargea: This model can be equipped with 1 grot oiler.
This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 tellyport blasta ◦ 1 kustom force field
This model’s kustom-mega blasta can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 killsaw ◦ 1 kombi-weapon ◦ 1 kustom shoota
datasheets.Rukkatrukk_Squigbuggy.abiliti: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks made with squig‑launchas and roll one D6: on a 4+, until the end of your opponent’s next turn, that enemy unit is hindered. While a unit is hindered, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

Once per battle, at the start of any phase, select one enemy unit within 3" of this model and roll one D6: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D6 mortal wounds.

Designer’s Note: Place a Squig Mine token next to the model, removing it once this ability has been used.
datasheets.Rukkatrukk_Squigbuggy.fluff: These vehicles started out as mobile food wagons, but became weapons of war the moment Orks realised how hilarious it was to pelt the enemy (or their mates) with squigs that latched on like living man‑traps, squigs that vomited corrosive or toxic juices, and squigs with a propensity for detonating like an artillery shell.
datasheets.Rukkatrukk_Squigbuggy.loadout: This model is equipped with: sawn-off shotgun; squig-launchas; saw blades.
datasheets.Beast_Snagga_Boyz.abilities.o: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.
datasheets.Beast_Snagga_Boyz.fluff: Big, brutal, and belligerent, Beast Snagga Boyz are a force to be reckoned with. From the cannonball-like fist-shells of their thump guns, to the inescapable hooks of their choppas, Beast Snaggas excel in softening up their prey, dragging them down, then ripping them bodily to bits.
datasheets.Beast_Snagga_Boyz.loadout:
The Beast Snagga Nob is equipped with: slugga; power snappa.
Every Beast Snagga Boy is equipped with: slugga; choppa.
datasheets.Beast_Snagga_Boyz.wargear.0: For every 10 models in this unit, 1 Beast Snagga Boy’s slugga and choppa can be replaced with 1 thump gun and 1 close combat weapon.
Each time this model’s unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit.
datasheets.Deffkilla_Wartrike.fluff: Ork Speedbosses thunder into battle on the backs of Deffkilla Wartrikes. These hurtling three‑wheelers boast massive jet engines that fry the foe to a crisp while roaring through their ranks. Wartrikes also offer platforms from which the Speedbosses can messily chainhaul unfortunate foes with their grapnel‑like snagga klaws.
datasheets.Deffkilla_Wartrike.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ WARBIKERS
datasheets.Deffkilla_Wartrike.loadout: This model is equipped with: boomstikks; killa jet; snagga klaw.
datasheets.Mek.abilities.other.0.name: Know-wotz
datasheets.Mek.abilities.other.0.descrip: While this model is within 3" of one or more friendly ORKS VEHICLE units, this model has the Lone Operative ability.
datasheets.Mek.abilities.other.1.name: Mekaniak
datasheets.Mek.abilities.other.1.descrip: At the end of your Movement phase, you can select one friendly ORKS VEHICLE model within 3" of this model. That VEHICLE model regains up to D3 lost wounds, and, until the start of your next Movement phase, each time that VEHICLE model makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. Each model can only be selected for this ability once per turn.
datasheets.Mek.fluff: Any Mekboy worth his spanners knows how to patch and repair Ork vehicles, artillery pieces and the like even amidst the fury of combat. Meks are also handy for a spot of good old‑fashioned dakka and close‑quarters violence, taking to the field armed to the teeth with kustom weaponry that they invented themselves.
datasheets.Mek.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BOYZ ■ LOOTAS ■ MEK GUNZ ■ NOBZ ■ TANKBUSTAS
datasheets.Mek.loadout: This model is equipped with: kustom mega‑slugga; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Mek.wargear.0: This model’s close combat weapon can be replaced with 1 killsaw.
datasheets.Shokkjump_Dragsta.abilities.o: Each time this model is selected to Advance, you can remove it from the battlefield and set it up again anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models instead of making an Advance move (this model is still considered to have Advanced this turn).
datasheets.Shokkjump_Dragsta.fluff: Combining shokk attack technology, great speed and a cheerful disregard for life and limb, the Shokkjump Dragsta provides the Orks with a vehicle that can teleport itself through – occasionally into – feet‑thick fortress walls while its kustom shokk rifle bores warp tunnels right through its luckless victims.
datasheets.Shokkjump_Dragsta.loadout: This model is equipped with: kustom shokk rifle; rokkits; saw blades.
datasheets.Mozrog_Skragbad.abilities.oth: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if it has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets a MONSTER or VEHICLE unit, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that attack. Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets a TITANIC unit, add 2 to the Damage characteristic of that attack instead.
datasheets.Mozrog_Skragbad.fluff: Mozrog and his squigosaur steed Big Chompa are so tough that they can weather the worst any foe throws at them. In return, few enemies survive for long once Mozrog tears into them with his kustom disembowelling punch‑dagger, Gutrippa. Those that do are doomed to be swallowed whole by Big Chompa’s yawning, fang‑stuffed jaws.
datasheets.Mozrog_Skragbad.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ SQUIGHOG BOYZ
datasheets.Mozrog_Skragbad.loadout: This model is equipped with: thump gun; Big Chompa’s jaws; gutrippa.
While this model is leading a unit:

■ Models in that unit have the Scouts 9" ability.
■ Each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.
■ Each time an attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
While the Waaagh! is active for your army, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in this model’s unit.
datasheets.Zodgrod_Wortsnagga.fluff: With his Grabzappa crackling, Zodgrod herds his notorious super runts into battle. This irascible loon is never happier than when wrangling especially large and rowdy foes, usually by giving them a good dose of needles from his Squigstoppa Numba 5, then burying them in a rampaging horde of diminutive little monsters.
datasheets.Zodgrod_Wortsnagga.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ GRETCHIN
datasheets.Zodgrod_Wortsnagga.loadout: This model is equipped with: Squigstoppa; Da Grabzappa.
datasheets.Gretchin.abilities.other.0.de: Each time an attack targets this unit, if it contains one or more Gretchin models, until that attack is resolved, Runtherd models in this unit have a Toughness characteristic of 2.
datasheets.Gretchin.abilities.other.1.de: At the start of your Movement phase, roll one D6 for each objective marker you control that has one or more units from your army with this ability within range of it (excluding Battle-shocked units). If one or more of those rolls is a 4+, you gain 1CP.
datasheets.Gretchin.fluff: What Gretchin – also called grots – lack in stature, courage, resilience, discipline, loyalty, aggression and personal hygiene, they allegedly make up for in numbers, especially when motivated by the brutal Ork wranglers known as Runtherds. They are at least reasonable shots with their underpowered firearms, and if all else fails, the Orks find that grots make excellent bullet‑stops.
datasheets.Gretchin.loadout:
Every Runtherd is equipped with: slugga; runtherd tools.
Every Gretchin is equipped with: grot blasta; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Big_Mek_with_Shokk_Attack_Gun: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks; that unit must take a Battle-shock test.
Once per battle, after rolling to determine how many attacks the bearer’s shokk attack gun makes, you can re-roll that dice.
1 Big Mek with Shokk Attack Gun

Big Meks are masters of insane but highly destructive weaponry. Amongst the strangest devices that some lug to battle is the shokk attack gun which opens a tunnel through the warp to its target, then launches screaming Snotlings down it. The ammunition rematerialise as a terror‑maddened, clawing, biting swarm. If this happens inside the target, the results are swift and horrific.
Big Mek with Shokk Attack Gun: Big Mek with Shokk Attack Gun
datasheets.Big_Mek_with_Shokk_Attack_Gun: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BOYZ ■ LOOTAZ ■ MEK GUNZ ■ NOBZ
This model is equipped with: close combat weapon, shokk attack gun.
This model can be equipped with 1 grot assistant.
datasheets.Kill_Rig.abilities.other.0.de: At the start of the Fight phase, you can select one friendly ORKS unit within 12" of this model and roll one D6: on a 1, this model suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2‑5, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit; on a 6, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit and those weapons have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
datasheets.Kill_Rig.fluff: The Kill Rig’s stikka kannon fires rokkit‑harpoons big enough to wrangle battle tanks. Its ’eavy lobba hits with ground‑quaking force, and the tramplasquig that tows this land barge can flatten a fortress gate. Yet it is the Wurrboy atop his wurrtower that both the enemy and the Beast Snaggas themselves fear the most.
datasheets.Kill_Rig.loadout: This model is equipped with: ’eavy lobba; stikka kannon; wurrtower; butcha boyz; savage horns and hooves; saw blades.
datasheets.Kill_Rig.rangedWeapons.1.abil: Each time this weapon scores a hit against an enemy Monster or Vehicle unit, until the end of the turn, if the bearer selects that unit as a target of a charge, add 2 to Charge rolls made for the bearer.
datasheets.Kill_Rig.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 11 BEAST SNAGGA INFANTRY models.
Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack with a burna that targets an enemy unit within 6", re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If the target of that attack is also within range of an objective marker, you can re‑roll the Wound roll instead.
datasheets.Burna_Boyz.fluff: The burna is a cutting torch intended for slicing up battlefield wreckage. Serendipitously, it also works well when searing through an enemy’s armour at close quarters, or, with a twist of its nozzle, can instead belch a tongue of roaring flame over the foe. Needless to say, the most pyromaniacally inclined Orks delight in doing both.
datasheets.Burna_Boyz.loadout:
Every Spanner is equipped with: close combat weapon; big shoota.
Every Burna Boy is equipped with: burna; cuttin’ flames.
datasheets.Burna_Boyz.stats.0.name: Burna Boy
datasheets.Nobz.abilities.other.0.name: Da Boss’ Ladz
datasheets.Nobz.abilities.other.0.descri: While a WARBOSS model is leading this unit, each time an attack targets this unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of this unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
datasheets.Nobz.abilities.wargear.0.desc: Once per battle for each ammo runt this unit has, when this unit is selected to shoot, it can use this ability. If it does, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
datasheets.Nobz.fluff: Nobz swagger into battle wielding a jaw‑dropping assortment of kombi‑weapons, favourite sluggas, very large choppas, piston‑driven klaws and any other instrument of gratuitous violence they can get their claws on. Coupled with their exceptional resilience and sheer belligerence, this renders them terrifying combatants indeed.
datasheets.Nobz.loadout: Every model is equipped with: slugga; big choppa.
datasheets.Nobz.stats.0.name: Nob
datasheets.Nobz.wargear.0: For every 5 models in this unit, this unit can be equipped with 1 ammo runt.
datasheets.Nobz.wargear.1: Any number of models can each have their slugga and big choppa replaced with 1 kombi-weapon and 1 close combat weapon.
datasheets.Nobz.wargear.2: Any number of models can each have their big choppa replaced with 1 power klaw.
datasheets.Beastboss_on_Squigosaur.abili: While this model is leading a unit, add 1 to Charge rolls made for that unit.
You can target this model’s unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.
datasheets.Beastboss_on_Squigosaur.fluff: Beastbosses have the strength and violent temperament to subdue the most ferocious creatures. Squigosaurs, meanwhile, are single‑minded predators that can bite through adamantine and shrug off enemy fire as though they were armour‑plated. If a Beastboss wishes to ride one he must first beat it within an inch of its life to teach it respect, all without getting devoured in the process.
datasheets.Beastboss_on_Squigosaur.loado: This model is equipped with: slugga; beastchoppa; squigosaur’s jaws.
datasheets.Beastboss_on_Squigosaur.warge: This model can be equipped with 1 thump gun.
datasheets.Meganobz.abilities.other.0.de: While the Waaagh! is active for your army, models in this unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.
datasheets.Meganobz.fluff: Mega armour comprises massive slabs of metal bashed roughly into shape, and is powered by pistons and sheer brute strength. It is highly resilient and can mount an array of potent weaponry. It is also usually worn to battle by toof‑rich Nobz who would be scary enough even were they not each wearing their own Ork‑portable bunker.
datasheets.Meganobz.loadout: Every model is equipped with: kustom shoota; power klaw.
datasheets.Meganobz.wargear.0: Any number of models can each have their kustom shoota and power klaw replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 kombi-weapon and 1 power klaw ◦ 1 kombi-weapon and 1 killsaw ◦ 1 kustom shoota and 1 killsaw ◦ 1 killsaw and 1 power klaw ◦ 1 twin killsaws
datasheets.Boomdakka_Snazzwagon.abilitie: While an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
datasheets.Boomdakka_Snazzwagon.fluff: The Boomdakka Snazzwagon is a high‑speed riot on wheels. Bristling with dakka and swarming with anarchic and excitable crew, the vehicle roars through the enemy lines in a storm of roiling smoke, whistling bullets, incendiary burna bottles and shockingly foul language before skidding around for another pass.
datasheets.Boomdakka_Snazzwagon.loadout: This model is equipped with: big shoota; grot blasta; Mek speshul; spiked wheels.
datasheets.Gargantuan_Squiggoth.abilitie: This model does not suffer the penalty to its Hit rolls for making ranged attacks while enemy units are within Engagement Range of it.
datasheets.Gargantuan_Squiggoth.fluff: Squiggoths can grow in size indefinitely. The larger they get, the more prized they become in the eyes of Ork Warbosses, whose simple minds see them for the colossal living weapons they are. Kitted out with armour, guns and bellowing passengers, truly giant specimens are walking bastions, their momentum all but unstoppable.
datasheets.Gargantuan_Squiggoth.loadout: This model is equipped with: huge tusks.
datasheets.Gargantuan_Squiggoth.transpor: This model has a transport capacity of 20 ORKS INFANTRY models. Each MEGA ARMOUR or JUMP PACK model takes up the space of 2 models. GHAZGHKULL THRAKA takes up the space of 18 models. If this model is equipped with a supa-kannon, it has a transport capacity of 15 ORKS INFANTRY models.
This model can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 kannon ◦ 1 supa-kannon
Each time this model ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit it moved over during that move. Until the end of the turn, models in that unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover. In addition, roll one D6 for each model in that unit: for each 6, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
datasheets.Burna_bommer.fluff: Meant for burning enemy infantry out of fortifications and dense cover, Burna‑bommers fly so low that they frequently scorch their undercarriage with their own ordnance. The Burna Boy pilots consider this a small price to pay in order to watch their victims do da burny dance as their skorcha missile racks and burna bombs rain down.
datasheets.Burna_bommer.loadout: This model is equipped with: twin big shoota; twin supa-shoota; armoured hull.
datasheets.Burna_bommer.wargear.0: This model can be equipped with 1 skorcha missile rack.
datasheets.Hunta_Rig.abilities.other.0.d: For each model embarked within this TRANSPORT, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s butcha boyz weapon (to a maximum of +6).
datasheets.Hunta_Rig.fluff: Welded, lashed and nailed together from enemy wrecks and scavenged scrap, the Hunta Rig forgoes a Wurrboy wurrtower – much to its crew’s relief. Instead it boasts an open metal deck and copious grab‑handles, the better for chanting and bellowing mobs of Beast Snagga Boyz to ride along on the hunt.
datasheets.Hunta_Rig.loadout: This model is equipped with: ’eavy lobba; stikka kannon; butcha boyz; savage horns and hooves; saw blades.
datasheets.Hunta_Rig.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 21 BEAST SNAGGA INFANTRY models.
datasheets.Warboss.abilities.other.1.des: While the Waaagh! is active for your army, add 4 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s melee weapons.
datasheets.Warboss.fluff: A towering slab of muscle, fangs and bad attitude, the Warboss leads the charge from the very front. With klaw, fist and dakka the green behemoth bulldozes a bloody path through the enemy. Meanwhile, his window‑rattling war cry and weapons‑grade glower motivate his ladz to ever more gratuitous violence.
